data.title: Why is -100Â° considered very very hot in Canada?
data.meta_description:
Answer (1 of 8): The coldest temperature ever recorded in Canada was -63 C (-81.4 F). That means that -100 C (-148 F) would be very, very cold and not hot.

However, if you put the minus sign in by mistake and you meant 100 C (212 F) then it would be very, very hot as that is the boiling point of...
